cs.man.ac.uk.tree

Interface Tree

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GHVFDT

    public interface Tree
    Basic interface for a decision tree.
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateLearningNode(InactiveLearningNode toActivate, SplitNode parent, int parentBranch)
      Activates a learning node, perhaps previous deactivated due to limited memory.
      void deactivateAllLeaves()
      Deactivates all leaves in the tree.
      void deactivateLearningNode(ActiveLearningNode toDeactivate, SplitNode parent, int parentBranch)
      Deactivates a learning node, useful when memory is limited.
      FoundNode[] findLearningNodes() 
      void findLearningNodes(Node node, SplitNode parent, int parentBranch, java.util.List<FoundNode> found)
      Finds the learning nodes recursively, starting at the specified node.

      AttributeClassObserver newNumericClassObserver() 
      SplitNode newSplitNode(InstanceConditionalTest splitTest, double[] classObservations, int size)
      Creates a new tree split node.
      void setBinarySplits(boolean binarySplits)
      Sets a flag allowing only binary tree splits.
      void setGracePeriod(int gracePeriod)
      Sets the number of instances a leaf should observe between split attempts.
      void setSplitConfidence(double splitConfidence)
      Sets the allowable error in split decision, values closer to 0 will take longer to decide.
      void setTieThreshold(double tieThreshold)
      Sets the threshold below which a split will be forced to break ties.

      Methods which determines the optimal split point.

    • Method Detail

      • setGracePeriod

        void setGracePeriod(int gracePeriod)
        Sets the number of instances a leaf should observe between split attempts.
        Parameters:
        gracePeriod - the number of instances a leaf should observe between split attempts.

      • setSplitConfidence

        void setSplitConfidence(double splitConfidence)
        Sets the allowable error in split decision, values closer to 0 will take longer to decide.
        Parameters:
        splitConfidence - the allowable error in the split decision.

      • setTieThreshold

        void setTieThreshold(double tieThreshold)
        Sets the threshold below which a split will be forced to break ties. This is used to break ties when two features are found to be equally good split points.
        Parameters:
        tieThreshold - the tie threshold

      • setBinarySplits

        void setBinarySplits(boolean binarySplits)
        Sets a flag allowing only binary tree splits. If set to false, than no binary splits can be used.
        Parameters:
        binarySplits - the new value for the flag.

      • split

        void split(ActiveLearningNode node,
           SplitNode parent,
           int parentIndex)
        Methods which determines the optimal split point.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node to split, if possible.
        parent - the parent of node.
        parentIndex - the index of the node in the parent, corresponding to which branch of the parent it belongs to.

      • newSplitNode

        SplitNode newSplitNode(InstanceConditionalTest splitTest,
                       double[] classObservations,
                       int size)
        Creates a new tree split node.
        Parameters:
        splitTest - the split point test.
        classObservations - the class distributions used to initialize the split point.
        size - the number of split point in the split, i.e. binary = 2, or non-binary.
        Returns:
        the new split point.

      • newLearningNode

        LearningNode newLearningNode()
        Returns:
        a new learning node capable of making predictions.

      • newLearningNode

        LearningNode newLearningNode(double[] initialClassObservations)
        Parameters:
        initialClassObservations - the class distributions used to initialize the node, and used for making predictions. The class distribution is stored in a double array, such that each element in the array contains the total count of examples for a specific class. For example initialClassObservations = [ 10 , 45 ] using zero indexing indicates there are 10 members of class zero, and 45 of class one.
        Returns:
        a new learning node capable of making predictions.

      • deactivateLearningNode

        void deactivateLearningNode(ActiveLearningNode toDeactivate,
                            SplitNode parent,
                            int parentBranch)
        Deactivates a learning node, useful when memory is limited.
        Parameters:
        toDeactivate - the node to deactivate.
        parent - the parent node of the node being deactivated.
        parentBranch - the index of the node being deactivated, in the parent, corresponding to which branch of the parent it belongs to.

      • activateLearningNode

        void activateLearningNode(InactiveLearningNode toActivate,
                          SplitNode parent,
                          int parentBranch)
        Activates a learning node, perhaps previous deactivated due to limited memory.
        Parameters:
        toActivate - the node to activate.
        parent - the parent node of the node being activated.
        parentBranch - the index of the node being activated, in the parent, corresponding to which branch of the parent it belongs to.

      • findLearningNodes

        FoundNode[] findLearningNodes()
        Returns:
        all learning nodes found in the tree.

      • findLearningNodes

        void findLearningNodes(Node node,
                       SplitNode parent,
                       int parentBranch,
                       java.util.List<FoundNode> found)
        Finds the learning nodes recursively, starting at the specified node. Found nodes are not returned directly, rather they are appended to the List object passed in to this method.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to search from.
        parent - of the node to search from, a split point node.
        parentBranch - the index of the node being activated, in the parent, corresponding to which branch of the parent it belongs to.
        found - the list to add found nodes to.

      • newNumericClassObserver

        AttributeClassObserver newNumericClassObserver()
        Returns:
        a new observer object used to monitor the data distributions for an individual feature.

      • deactivateAllLeaves

        void deactivateAllLeaves()
        Deactivates all leaves in the tree.
